questions.question: Which feature allows you to keep the top row of your table visible while you scroll down to the bottom of a long list?
questions.explanation: Freeze Panes locks specific rows or columns (like headers) in place so they don't disappear when scrolling.

questions.question: In the View tab, which view is best used to adjust exactly where a new page begins for printing?
questions.explanation: Page Break Preview displays watermark page numbers and allows you to drag blue lines to adjust print breaks.

questions.question: Otter.ai is an AI tool primarily used for:
options: Recording and transcribing meetings/audio into text
questions.explanation: Otter.ai provides automated meeting notes and transcription using artificial intelligence.

questions.question: What is a 'Macro' in Excel?
options: A recorded set of actions that can be run to automate repetitive tasks
questions.explanation: Macros are scripts that record your mouse clicks and keystrokes to replay them later, saving time on repetitive work.

questions.question: Which SmartArt layout is most suitable for creating a 'Family Tree'?
questions.explanation: A Hierarchy chart is designed to show structural relationships, such as a family tree or an organization chart.

questions.question: The 'Split' command in the Window group does what?
options: Divides the current window into two or four scrollable panes
questions.explanation: Split divides the window so you can view distant parts of the same worksheet at the same time.

questions.question: If you want to view two open Excel workbooks side-by-side on your monitor, which button should you click?
questions.explanation: Arrange All tiles all open Excel windows (Tiled, Horizontal, Vertical) so they fit on the screen together.

questions.question: Which checkbox in the 'Show' group allows you to hide the gridlines (the faint gray lines separating cells) on the screen?
questions.explanation: Unchecking the 'Gridlines' box in the View tab creates a clean, white background without cell borders.

questions.question: What is the purpose of IFTTT (If This Then That)?
options: To automate tasks by connecting different apps and services
questions.explanation: IFTTT is an automation tool that lets you create chains of simple conditional statements (applets) between apps.

questions.question: The 'Zoom to Selection' feature:
options: Magnifies the sheet so the currently selected cells fill the entire window
Zooms out to see the whole page
questions.explanation: This allows you to focus closely on a specific range of data by filling the screen with just that selection.

questions.question: Which feature in Excel uses AI to automatically identify patterns and create charts or summaries from your table?
questions.explanation: The Analyze Data button (formerly Ideas) uses AI to answer natural language questions about your data.

questions.question: What does the 'New Window' command allow you to do?
options: Open a second window displaying the *same* workbook so you can work on two sheets simultaneously
questions.explanation: New Window creates another view of the current document, allowing you to edit Sheet 1 in one window and Sheet 2 in another.

questions.question: If the Formula Bar is missing from your screen, where can you turn it back on?
questions.explanation: The visibility of the Formula Bar is toggled via a checkbox in the Show group of the View tab.

questions.question: Page Layout View is primarily useful for:
options: Visualizing headers, footers, and margins exactly as they will print
questions.explanation: Page Layout view shows the document page-by-page, including rulers and header/footer areas.

questions.question: Why create a Family Tree?
options: To visualize ancestry, understand relationships, and track family medical history
questions.explanation: Family trees preserve heritage and help understand generational relationships and history.

questions.question: Which option allows you to save a specific display setting (like hidden rows and print settings) to quickly return to it later?
questions.explanation: Custom Views allow you to save the current view settings (hidden rows/columns, filter settings) and switch back to them instantly.

questions.question: The 'Switch Windows' button is useful when:
options: You have multiple Excel files open and want to jump quickly between them
You want to switch to Word
You want to turn off the computer
questions.explanation: Switch Windows lists all currently open Excel workbooks for fast navigation.

questions.question: The 'Zoom Slider' is usually located:
options: In the View Tab ribbon only
At the bottom-right corner of the Excel status bar
questions.explanation: While Zoom options are in the View tab, the Slider for quick adjustment is always on the bottom-right status bar.

questions.question: Which of these file extensions supports Macros?
questions.explanation: Standard .xlsx files cannot save macros for security reasons; you must save as .xlsm (Excel Macro-Enabled Workbook).

questions.question: When creating a Family Tree in Excel using shapes, which feature helps align them perfectly?
questions.explanation: Align tools (Align Center, Distribute Vertically) and Snap to Grid help keep the flowchart shapes organized.
